definitions.structures.abstr.vectorspaces

Interface NormedSpace

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Group, MetricSpace, Monoid, SemiGroup, java.io.Serializable, VectorSpace, XmlPrintable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DiscreetField, EuclideanAlgebra, EuclideanFunctionSpace, EuclideanSpace, Field, FiniteDomain, FiniteField, FinitePrimeField, InnerProductSpace, ParameterizedSpace, PrimeField
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComplexPlane, FiniteDimensionalFunctionSpace, FiniteDimensionalSobolevSpace, FiniteDimensionalVectorSpace, FunctionalSpace, PolynomialFunctionSpace, QuaternionSpace, RealLine, TrigonometricSobolevSpace, TrigonometricSpace

    public interface NormedSpace
extends VectorSpace, MetricSpace
    Author:
    RoManski A normed space N is a vector space over a field F which is also a metric space with a mapping FxN-|R. The distance function is induced by the norm.

      • normalize

        default Vector normalize(Vector vec)
        Any non-zero vector can be normalized. The normalization of a vector is a vector pointing towards the same direction with norm 1.
        Parameters:
        vec - the vector to be normalized.
        Returns:
        the normalized vector.
